pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f3f117a541](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18321/commits/f3f117a541f35e49d5bfc8fcb7d3f6bbc5b8139d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>32 files</summary> `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.OpenImmersion` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Proper` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Preimmersion` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Sites.BigZariski` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Basic` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.IsIso` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.UnderlyingMap` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.QuasiCompact` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.ClosedImmersion` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Noetherian` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.RingHomProperties` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.ResidueField` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Pullbacks` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.ProjectiveSpectrum.Scheme` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Properties` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Affine` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Immersion` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Separated` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.SpreadingOut` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.FunctionField` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Constructors` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Smooth` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.AffineScheme` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Limits` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.QuasiSeparated` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.FinitePresentation` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.FiniteType` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Stalk` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.GammaSpecAdjunction` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.GluingOneHypercover` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Restrict` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.UniversallyClosed`</details>|2|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Comma.OverClass`|277|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Over`|1691|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ CanonicallyOver`
`+ CanonicallyOverClass`
`+ CanonicallyOverClass.Simps.over`
`+ Hom.IsOver`
`+ HomIsOver`
`+ IsOverTower`
`+ Opens.fromSpecStalkOfMem_ι`
`+ Over`
`+ OverClass`
`+ OverClass.Simps.over`
`+ comp_over`
`+ instance (X : Scheme.{u}) (x : X) : (Spec (X.presheaf.stalk x)).CanonicallyOver X`
`+ instance (X : Scheme.{u}) (x : X) : (Spec (X.presheaf.stalk x)).Over X := ⟨X.fromSpecStalk x⟩`
`+ instance (X : Scheme.{u}) : X.Over (⊤_ _) := ⟨terminal.from _⟩`
`+ instance (x : X) : (Spec (X.residueField x)).CanonicallyOver X`
`+ instance (x : X) : (Spec (X.residueField x)).Over X := ⟨X.fromSpecResidueField x⟩`
`+ instance : U.toScheme.CanonicallyOver X`
`+ instance : U.toScheme.Over X := ⟨U.ι⟩`
`+ instance [CanonicallyOverClass X S]`
`+ instance [CanonicallyOverClass X Y] [OverClass Y S] : IsOverTower X Y S`
`+ instance [CanonicallyOverClass X Y] [OverClass Y S] : OverClass X S := ⟨X ⮕ Y ≫ Y ⮕ S⟩`
`+ instance [OverClass X S]`
`+ instance [X.Over Y] (x : X) : Spec.map ((X ⮕ Y).residueFieldMap x) |>.IsOver Y`
`+ instance [X.Over Y] {x} : Spec.map ((X ⮕ Y).stalkMap x) |>.IsOver Y`
`+ instance {X : Scheme.{u}} (U : X.Opens) (x : X) (hxU : x ∈ U) :`
`+ instance {X Y : Scheme.{u}} (f : X ⟶ Y) : f.IsOver (⊤_ _) := ⟨terminal.hom_ext _ _⟩`
`+ instance {x y : X} (h : x = y) : (Spec.map (X.residueFieldCongr h).hom).IsOver X`
`+ instance {x y : X} (h : x ⤳ y) : (Spec.map (X.presheaf.stalkSpecializes h)).IsOver X`
`+ isOver_of_isOverTower`
`+ morphism`
`+ over`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

> My main worry about this approach is the friction with category theory.

I think this friction will be present when you want to switch between different over categories anyways so this is why I went for this design.
This looks nice. Do you plan to add some interaction with `CategoryTheory.Over`? At least an `asOver` declaration and an `OverClass X.left S` will be useful, but can be done in a later PR.

I have said this at a different place before, but let me repeat here for reference: I generally think this is a good way forward, the alternatives I see are

- Migrate to `HasForget₂ C Scheme`, but this would mean a refactor of big parts of AG and causes at least coercions (or even worse, incarnations of `(forget₂ _ _).obj`) to pop up in most places.
- Try with a coercion from `Over S` to `Scheme` and similarly for morphisms. This approach integrates probably better with the category theory API, but will also require a bunch of explicit coercions. 

What I like about the `IsOver` approach is that we essentially do the mathlib typeclass based style but replace `Type` by `Scheme`.

My main worry about this approach is the friction with category theory, because there will be a bunch of over-like categories where we really want to talk about the objects of that category (e.g. schemes étale over `S`). We will certainly need some `def asOver {X} [X.Over S] : Over S` and for the other direction maybe a coercion with an `X.left.Over S` instance would work.
This looks nice. Do you plan to add some interaction with `CategoryTheory.Over`? At least an `asOver` declaration and an `OverClass X.left S` will be useful, but can be done in a later PR.
I think we should define this for an arbitrary category `C` instead and probably name it `IsOver`. If we want the nice `X.Over S` notation, we can have an `abbrev` for `Scheme.Over`.

Is there a concrete application outside of `Scheme` in mind? I am aware that this `Over` class is slightly abusing the typeclass system, and is only added here because of a conscious design choice due to the fact that we more often than not view morphisms as structures in algebraic geometry. OTOH I'm not so sure about this being introduced and used in arbitrary categories.
Well, I think any geometric theory building upon category theory will encounter the same issue, e.g. adic spaces.
Hmmmm. I'll move this to category with a strong warning then.

I am not sure how useful this will be in practice. It's nice that we can have your
```
instance [X.CanonicallyOver Y] [Y.Over S] : X.Over S := _
```
But is that so common? I am guessing that we mostly want to work with `IsOverTower` as an assumption instead as we do in commutative algebra.

If `X` is an `S` scheme, we would want various constructions to be `S`-schemes as well e.g. open subschemes, $$\mathrm{Spec}\mathcal{O}_{X, x}$$, affine spaces, base changes to `X` etc. 
You are right that `CanonicallyOver` should not in general appear as assumptions.
Hmm, but I think all the examples should work without `CanonicallyOver` (they do work with `Algebra`)
Ah nevermind, you mean base change with target `X` not with target `S`. Then indeed there are compositions involved in this case.
All examples are all a priori `X`-schemes an not `S`-schemes I believe.
Yes, you are right and in the example where e.g. `S = Spec k` this is indeed desirable.

```suggestion
  `HomIsOver f S` asserts that `f` commutes with the structure morphisms.
```

Maybe `↘` or `⭲` (first one underlining the `Over`, second one underlining that `S` is the base) are less in the foreground than `⮕`? (In my mind `⮕` makes my attention focus a lot on the often unimportant structure morphism)

```suggestion
```
These could also go in the general part, might need additional imports though. Do however you prefer.

```suggestion
```

pullRequest.title: feat(AlgebraicGeometry): typeclasses for `S`-schemes
